intro: Microstegium monanthum, commonly known as the common wood sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Microstegium monanthum is often considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid spread and competitive growth.
